description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8koar","text":"This protocol was developed as a semi-high throughput technique to perform phage display immunopreceipitation. Here we describe all the steps: from isolating antibodies from a complex matrix of patient sample, washing the sample and amplify targets through two rounds of selection. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"altmh","text":"Make blocking solution to prevent sample and library from binding to plates. This step also helps with movement of protein A/G beads later on. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"borks","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hkbo","text":"        Blocking solution (make fresh for every experiment) :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tpa2","text":"            3.0% BSA Fraction V","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2k1r4","text":"            1x TBS-Tween","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmhb6","text":"            Mix thoroughly and filter through a 0.22um filter","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s83h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8g3rt","text":"Aliquot blocking solution into Round-bottom 96 well 2ml deep well plates according to the number of wells and plates needed for experiment for both rounds of IPs. Seal tightly with foil seal. {"blocks":[{"key":"cvfsf","text":"After plates have sufficiently blocked, unseal plates and discard all blocking solution contained in one set of IP plates by dumping the contents into the sink and gently tapping on clean paper towels. Continue blocking the other set of plates for round two of IP. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ph0d","text":"Add   of phage library per well. If a canary well is desired (to control for phage contamination of reagents during the protocol) add SM buffer to the canary well instead of the phage library.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"F6AC6500DA8911EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":"80213","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6tq59","text":"Add sample to library. Amounts will vary depending on sample type and concentration of IgG in sample:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10vi2","text":"  of serum OR plasma in 1x Storage Buffer ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c2bel","text":"  of CSF in 1x Storage Buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5kctp","text":"  of Commercial Antibody (for positive control, recommend to put one of these on each plate randomized location.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f4q4n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ansar","text":"An optional but recommended sample type is also an AG control well with no sample to control for nonspecific binding of phage library to A/G beads. We Recommend putting 1-2 of these on each plate in a random location. {"blocks":[{"key":"d8uvb","text":"Seal plate tightly (should be able to see outline of the individual wells) with foil seal and plastic plate sealer tool. Then, incubate by inverting overhead or on rocker platform at     (minimum of 6 hours, maximum of 18 hours) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":183,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":185,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8477j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"120D36D0DA8A11EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":"44614","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"C93DFE30DA8911EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":"74301","label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dnbdl","text":"On a clean, phage-free lab bench, prepare an overnight starter culture of E.coli (BLT5403) as a working stock from a frozen glycerol stock in LB-Carb.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dk2c1","text":"Prepare A/G Beads:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b47m9","text":"NOTE: handle the beads gently using wide bore tips if possible to prevent damaging the beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tc5q","text":"Fully re-suspend beads by gently flipping by hand or placing on overhead rotator.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fg85t","text":"Calculate amount of beads needed. For the peptidome library we use   of A and   of G beads per reaction however some prefer to use   of A and   of G per reaction to increase the capture of IgG and IgA.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":78,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":131,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":142,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6dnul","text":"Mix packed Protein A and Protein G beads in a 1:1 ratio.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6tr5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"312D0C70DA8A11EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":"80217","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"33E4B260DA8A11EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":"80218","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"FA3FCF80DA8A11EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":"80219","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"FCD76A50DA8A11EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":"80220","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9mdj","text":"Aliquot amount of beads needed into a container able to hold more twice the volume of beads. We typically use a 5mL eppendorf tube or 15mL conical tube. Add 1x bead volume of cold TNP40 and mix overhead for   at   or until fully resuspended. Place on magnetic rack until beads fully pelleted. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":207,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":212,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8r9jl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"0BD2B640DA8B11EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":"74302","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"0E593A10DA8B11EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":"44615","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b9d95","text":"Remove supernatant and immediately add cold TNP40 again. Mix overhead again. Repeat this wash step a total of three times to fully remove the solution that the beads were stored in. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fd4ch","text":"On the final wash step, elute the beads in enough TNP40 for the number of reactions needed. From experience, eluting in   per reaction works well to form a nice droplet with the widebore tips when adding beads to the peptidome and sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":120,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"415D55F0DA8A11EBA9E7F9DBBCD6766E","id":"80221","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}
